thread.title: A wine dinner for fall at 5 O'Clock in Pewaukee
thread.title_full: A wine dinner for fall at 5 O'Clock in Pewaukee

title: A wine dinner for fall at 5 O'Clock in Pewaukee
text:
Espresso Lane | News and Notes A wine dinner for fall at 5 O'Clock in Pewaukee By Carol Deptolla of the Journal Sentinel Oct. 20, 2015 11:18 a.m. 
The 5 O'Clock Club in Pewaukee is embracing autumn with a five-course wine dinner on Tuesday. 
Chef Jason Knutson will prepare this menu: 
Pate, duck rillettes and basil, red pepper and mascarpone bruschetta; squash soup with maple creme fraiche, crisp pancetta and thyme croutons; turbot fillet with roasted root vegetables, porcini broth and greens; Angus beef short ribs with truffled bordelaise, sweet potato puree, gaufrette, Swiss chard and grilled mushrooms; and chocolate fudge cake with Italian plum compote, toasted walnuts and pumpkin-spice ice cream. 
The reception will be at 6:30 p.m., and dinner is at 7. It's $65, which includes the wines, tax and tip. Reserve seats by calling the restaurant at (262) 691-9960. The 5 O'Clock Club is at N28-W26658 Peterson Drive. 
Know of an upcoming event centered on dining, cooking or spirits? Email cdeptolla@journalsentinel.com . Â© 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved. About Carol Deptolla 
Carol Deptolla is the Journal Sentinel dining critic. She also reports on restaurants, bars and other food- and drink-related businesses.
